highSignals: Fields with qualitative foundations: sociology, anthropology, social work, communication studies, education research, nursing/health services research, oral/public history

Research topics requiring human-centered methods: stigma, lived experience, identity, families, communities, health equity/disparities, violence prevention, child welfare, sexual/reproductive health, LGBTQ+ health, trauma narratives
Participatory language: partnering with communities, community-based, centering voices, underserved/marginalized populations
Academic research roles: PI, lab/center director, research scientist, assistant/associate/full professor with population-focused studies
Explicit methodology mentions: qualitative, ethnography, interviews, focus groups, grounded theory, phenomenology, narrative inquiry, oral history, mixed methods
Sensitive population research requiring IRB oversight: HIV/AIDS, mental health, suicide/self-harm, child abuse, sexual health, immigration
lowSignals: Clinical-only roles without research: MD, fellow, resident focused on patient care (no PI/researcher in title)
Quantitative-primary fields: epidemiology (unless 'social'), biostatistics, data science, computational methods
Support roles: research coordinator, research assistant (not lead researcher)
Industry or corporate affiliations rather than university/research institute
domainContext: Target users conduct human-subjects research requiring: participant recruitment/tracking, interview scheduling, transcription services (including multilingual), IRB compliance documentation, secure storage for sensitive data, and team collaboration on qualitative coding/analysis. They study populations and phenomena that cannot be reduced to numbers alone.
